QuestionStatement: Supply side economists argue that
AnswerChoices: A cut in high tax rates results in an increased deficit and thus increases aggregate supply
Lower tax rates provide positive work incentives and thus shift the aggregate supply curve to the right
The aggregate supply of goods can only be increased if the price level falls
Increased government spending should be used to stimulate the economy
The government should regulate the supply of imports

QuestionStatement: An increase in which of the following would cause the long-run aggregate supply curve to shift to the right?
AnswerChoices: Corporate income tax rates
Aggregate demand
Potential output
The average wage rate
The price level

QuestionStatement: Total spending in the economy is most likely to increase by the largest amount if which of the following occur to government spending and taxes?
AnswerChoices: A
B
C
D
E

QuestionStatement: If businesses are experiencing an unplanned increase in inventories, which of the following is most likely to be true?
AnswerChoices: Aggregate demand is greater than output, and the level of spending will increase
Aggregate demand is less than output, and the level of spending will decrease
The economy is growing and will continue to grow until a new equilibrium level of spending is reached
Planned investment is greater than planned saving, and the level of spending will decrease
Planned investment is less than planned saving, and the level of spending will increase

QuestionStatement: According to the Keynesian model, an expansionary fiscal policy would tend to cause which of the following changes in output and interest rates?
AnswerChoices: A
B
C
D
E

QuestionStatement: The cost of reducing unemployment is accepting a higher rate of inflation.The statement above would most likely be made by a person who believes in the
AnswerChoices: Quantity theory of money
Phillips curve
Theory of rational expectations
Paradox of value
Liquidity trap

QuestionStatement: Which of the following will occur as a result of an improvement in technology?
AnswerChoices: The aggregate demand curve will shift to the right
The aggregate demand curve will shift to the left
The aggregate supply curve will shift to the right
The aggregate supply curve will shift to the left
The production possibilities curve will shift inward

QuestionStatement: If, in response to an increase in investment of $10 billion, equilibrium income rises by a total of $50 billion, then marginal propensity to save is
Which of the following is a possible cause of stagflation (simultaneous high unemployment and high inflation)?
AnswerChoices: Increase in labor productivity
Increase in price for raw materials
The rapid growth and development of the computer industry
A decline in labor union membership
A low growth rate of the money supply

QuestionStatement: The diagram above shows two aggregate supply curves, AS1 and AS2.  Which of the following statements most accurately characterizes the AS1 curve relative to the AS2 curve?
AnswerChoices: AS1 is Keynesian because it reflects greater wage and price flexibility
AS1 is classical because it reflects greater wage and price flexibility
AS1 is Keynesian because it reflects less wage and price flexibility
AS1 is classical because it reflects less wage and price flexibility
AS1 could be either classical or Keynesian because it reflects greater wage flexibility but less price flexibility

QuestionStatement: If the marginal propensity to consume is 0.9, what is the maximum amount that the equilibrium gross national product could change if government expenditures increase by $1 billion?
AnswerChoices: It could decrease by up to $9 billion
It could increase by up to $0.9 billion
It could increase by up to $1 billion
It could increase by up to $9 billion
It could increase by up to $10 billion

QuestionStatement: The figure above represents an economy with no government and no foreign sector.  Which of the following statements about this economy is true?
AnswerChoices: At Y, planned investment is less than saving
At Y, planned investment is equal to saving
At Y, planned investment is greater than saving
At full employment, total spending is equal to total income
At full employment, planned investment is equal to saving

QuestionStatement: Expansionary fiscal policy will be most effective when
AnswerChoices: The aggregate supply curve is horizontal
The economy is at or above full employment output
Transfer payments are decreased, while taxes remain unchanged
Wages and prices are very flexible
The Federal Reserve simultaneously increases the reserve requirement

QuestionStatement: Which of the following would increase the value of the multiplier?
AnswerChoices: An increase in government expenditure
An increase in exports
A decrease in government unemployment benefits
A decrease in the marginal propensity to consume
A decrease in the marginal propensity to save

QuestionStatement: Which of the following will be true if inflation can be accurately forecast and both prices and wages are fully flexible?
AnswerChoices: Long periods of high unemployment will be possible
The supply of labor will be insensitive to the real wage rate
The Phillips curve will be vertical
The equilibrium unemployment rate will be zero
Real interest rates will be greater than nominal interest rates

QuestionStatement: Which of the following policies is most likely to encourage long-run economic growth in a country?
AnswerChoices: An embargo on high technology imports
A decline in the number of immigrants to the country
An increase in government transfer payments
An increase in the per capita savings rate
An increase in defense spending

QuestionStatement: An increase in which of the following will increase the value of the spending multiplier?
AnswerChoices: The supply of money
Equilibrium output
Personal income tax rates
The marginal propensity to consume
The required reserve ratio

QuestionStatement: According to the Keynesian model, which of the following would increase aggregate demand?
AnswerChoices: An increase in autonomous investment
An increase in the discount rate
A decrease in unemployment compensation payments
A decrease in government expenditures accompanied by an equal reduction in taxes
A decrease in government expenditures on public works

QuestionStatement: The graph above indicates equilibrium at E for a closed economy without government spending.  If the addition of government spending results in equilibrium at F, which of the following is true?
AnswerChoices: Government spending is $300 and the multiplier is 5
Government spending is $100 and the multiplier is 5
Government spending is $100 and consumption increases by $500
Government spending and gross domestic product increase by $500 each
Consumption and gross domestic product increase by $500 each

QuestionStatement: According to Keynesian theory, decreasing taxes and increasing government spending will most likely change consumption expenditures and unemployment in which of the following ways?
AnswerChoices: A
B
C
D
E

QuestionStatement: In an economy at full employment, a presidential candidate proposes cutting the government debt in half in four years by increasing tax rates and reducing government expenditures.  According to Keynesian theory, implementation of these policies is most likely to increase
AnswerChoices: Unemployment
Consumer prices
Aggregate demand
Aggregate supply
The rate of economic growth

QuestionStatement: According to the graph above, which of the following will necessarily result in a decrease in output?I.      A rightward shift of the aggregate demand curveII.      A leftward shift of the aggregate demand curveIII.      A rightward shift of the aggregate supply curveIV.      A leftward shift of the aggregate supply curve
AnswerChoices: I only
III only
I and III only
II and III only
II and IV only

QuestionStatement: Which of the following will result in the greatest increase in aggregate demand?
AnswerChoices: A $100 increase in taxes
A $100 decrease in taxes
A $100 increase in government expenditures
A $100 increase in government expenditures, coupled with a $100 increase in taxes
A $100 increase in government expenditures, coupled with a $100 decrease in taxes

QuestionStatement: If the marginal propensity to consume increase, the equilibrium levels of income and consumption will change in which of the following ways?
AnswerChoices: A
B
C
D
E

QuestionStatement: If private investment of $100 is added to the economy, the equilibrium levels of income and consumption will change in which of the following ways?
AnswerChoices: A
B
C
D
E
